description: Parameter descriptors for earnings tools with temporal disambiguation

parameters.description: List of company identifiers for complete earnings announcement history. Returns ALL earnings announcements (past and future).
common_mistakes: Using this when you only want latest earnings (use get_latest_earnings_from_identifiers instead)
Using this when you only want next earnings (use get_next_earnings_from_identifiers instead)
Expecting only recent earnings (this returns complete history)

parameters.description: List of company identifiers for the most recent earnings announcement only. Use for 'latest', 'most recent', or 'last' earnings questions.
common_mistakes: Using this for future earnings (use get_next_earnings_from_identifiers instead)
Using this for complete history (use get_earnings_from_identifiers instead)
Confusing 'latest' (past) with 'next' (future)

parameters.description: List of company identifiers for upcoming/future earnings announcements. Use for 'next', 'upcoming', or 'scheduled' earnings questions.
common_mistakes: Using this for past earnings (use get_latest_earnings_from_identifiers instead)
Using this for complete history (use get_earnings_from_identifiers instead)
Confusing 'next' (future) with 'latest' (past)

parameters.description: List of company identifiers (tickers, ISINs, etc.) to retrieve earnings call timestamps for. Batch multiple identifiers when comparing call schedules across peers.
common_mistakes: Omitting identifiers entirelyâ€”this tool requires at least one company
Supplying key_dev_id instead of identifiers (use transcripts tool for key_dev_id)
Making separate calls instead of batching related companies

parameters.description: Type of call to retrieve. For standard earnings calls use 'earnings_call'. Other types include 'investor_day' or 'conference_call' when available.
common_mistakes: Leaving call_type blank (defaults vary and may cause description errors)
Using natural language like 'earnings' or 'call' instead of the canonical option
Requesting transcript content (use transcripts tools)

parameters.description: Lower bound (inclusive) for call schedule queries. Use YYYY-MM-DD. Required when the user references specific historic windows (e.g., 'Q4 2023').
common_mistakes: Leaving start_date empty while providing end_date, causing mismatched ranges
Using natural language like 'last quarter' instead of explicit date
Setting start_date after end_date

parameters.description: Upper bound (inclusive) for call schedule queries. Use YYYY-MM-DD. Pair with start_date to cover the period requested.
common_mistakes: Leaving end_date empty when start_date is provided
Setting end_date before start_date
Using ambiguous phrases like 'quarter end' without exact dates
